citation.article-title: Mucilaginibacter rigui sp. nov., isolated from wetland freshwater, and emended description of the genus Mucilaginibacter
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Mucilaginibacter Pankratov et al. 2007 emend. Urai et al. 2008
The description of the genus Mucilaginibacter is as given by Pankratov et al. (2007) and emended by Urai et al. (2008) with the following modifications.
Oxidase activity, hydrolysis of aesculin, pectin, starch and xylan, production of flexirubin-type pigments and cyclic cell shape change are species-dependent.
Show strictly aerobic or facultatively anaerobic metabolism.
The predominant quinone is MK-7, but some species contain MK-6 as well.
The major fatty acids are straight- and branched-saturated fatty acids, but some species contain summed feature 3 (C16 : 1 ω7c and/or iso-C15 : 0 2-OH) as well.
The DNA G+C content varies between 42.4 and 47 mol%.
